text: Carla Ragin Bozulich (born December 24, 1965)"United States Public Records, 1970-2009," database, FamilySearch (Carla Ragin Bozulich Los Angeles, California, United States; a third party aggregator of publicly available information. is an American musician. She is known for being the lead singer of the Geraldine Fibbers. She was born in New York City. In 1993 Happy Days, Sweetheart, the only album by Ethyl Meatplow, a band Bozulich was a member of, was released. In 2003 she released her first solo album, The Red Headed Stranger. In 2012 she released an album with Ches Smith. == References == ==Other websites== *Official website Category:American guitarists Category:Musicians from New York City Category:Living people Category:1965 births
title: Carla Bozulich
